channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @jwalkerjr thanks. i had been struggling to figure this out for a long time. ;-)

WordPress is huge. I'm wondering if another blogging system could develop in competition with WordPress, using the same model they use. An open source base, with a commercial service. Or will evolution allow only one huge open source blogging system. https://t.co/dwVzdKyEwo
March 4: Evolution in software. https://t.co/dwVzdKyEwo

@markzip @backlon worldle is either impossible or ridiculous. Have you looked at today's puzzle? Here's a screen shot for the archive. I didn't solve it, don't want to be a spoiler. ;-) https://t.co/b5eHEy3nhn

Twitter is already off to a decent start with a structure that represents a tweet and another that represents a user. It probably could be reconciled with an <item> in RSS. They are doing the same thing. And not surprisingly it's also a good match. https://t.co/Fl059yY02S
Here's an example of a tweet as a JavaScript object, as defined by Twitter the company.
https://t.co/vLEF62IWhK
Newsom calls for "end to this carnage" after Sacramento shooting. https://t.co/OrYgWBEumq

If the Dems had a passion for humanity theyâ€™d ratify 20 new Supreme Court justices this year, and pass a law that limits the term of a justice to ten years. I am not a lawyer but I read a book written by one and this is what the author recommends, and he makes a compelling case
The bookâ€¦
https://t.co/XOsSdtmY2p
Denzel Washington Finally Speaks Out About Will Smith Slapping Chris Rock At The Oscars. https://t.co/iV1rVhLVB4
@KenSmith Imagine if Twitter had started with the idea that messages were mutable. What difference might that have made?

@jeffjarvis thanks for explaining. ;-)
@jeffjarvis i don't get it

One of these decades the tech industry is going to grow the fuck up and stop insisting on being the boy wonder and respect what has been accomplished before they showed up. Then we wonâ€™t have to constantly be retooling and ripping up the pavement and starting over.

I donâ€™t buy this idea that Russia canâ€™t lose in Ukraine, after all the United States lost in both Iraq and Afghanistan. And letâ€™s not forget Vietnam. A big adult country doesnâ€™t have to win every battle it chooses to fight. https://t.co/8rjluwpBS3
Vintage vs Modern Home Stereo. https://t.co/V1VM9A0Tss
A Push to Remove LGBTQ Books in One County Could Signal Rising Partisanship on School Boards. https://t.co/6as3xIZ2Cu

@jack In everything I read about bluesky there was no plan to use what was built with rss. I saw activitypub, xmpp, but no rss. jack, as you might imagine, my work builds on rss so weâ€™ll be competing. so unnecessary. Just like a bigco. Come down off your pedestal, be a mensch.
One way Twitter and Drummer are connectedâ€¦ https://t.co/6a1eeKlaY1
@jack hopefully our stuff works together. good luck.
@wmf that's better than what google did. i haven't heard them offer to help put the open web back together. jack hasn't either, but he did just open the door to it.

A user said heâ€™d be more inclined to use Drummer if i planned for it to continue to work after I stop working. First, yes I did plan the best I could. All your files are in an open format which can be read by most outliners.
You can easily and quickly download all your files with a single command and you should do it frequently.
If you want it to keep running, help out next time there are new features, get involved in testing. Anyone can do it.
A Realistic Defense of Skiing the East. https://t.co/oyhqXhXg8p
